channel.title: Help for once?
channel.description: I never get a good reply, but what the heck. Jarring my client isnt working because I have more than one file with class files in it, but If I move any of them, it doesnt load anymore. I dont have a "bin" folder... What do I do? Base is Pi.

item.title: Help for once?
item.dc:creator: @Dario14 Dario14
item.description:
@Dario14 wrote:

i could help you over teamviewer if its as simple as it sounds

Read full topic

item.title: Help for once?
item.dc:creator: @ladaswa ladaswa
item.description:
@ladaswa wrote:

I don’t know what’s wrong, because I’ve never had an error with a client before. I have a webclient online, right now. But I’m switching to my own custom source, and I’m confused where the mistake was made.

Read full topic

item.title: Help for once?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“ladaswa, post:8, topic:457681”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=560605.msg4092590#msg4092590 date=1346534842]

I have a raw folder with alot of ######.dat files in it.
A sign folder with signlink.java and signlink.class
And the rest of the class files and java files are in the main client folder.
How do I make it ready to jar for a webclient?

Put those .dat files in the cache. Then delete all the .java files. And jar.
[/quote]

Didnt Work?[/quote]
Obviously there’s more work to be done.

Read full topic

item.title: Help for once?
item.dc:creator: @T7S T7S
item.description:
@T7S wrote:

The Web Guy:

When jarring a webclient, only the .class files are needed, the run.bat, and compile.bat aren’t needed. For 317/PI generally you want the mainclass to be client.class …

Or, you could just use youtube and the jarmaker.exe

Read full topic

item.title: Help for once?
item.dc:creator: @Devastational Devastational
item.description:
@Devastational wrote:

All you have to do is empty all of the files out. So everything is out when you open up the client. The only things that should be in a folder are :

Signlink.java
Signlink.class
Aaa.bat/exe (If you have that).

Those 2/3 things should be in a folder called “sign”. After doing all of that it should look something like this.

ztzyfa.jpg569×699
(Sorry for the bad quality, I shrink it down a bit). Hope I helped

Read full topic
